Sezo Audio Engine ships two packages: an Android package (native AAR) and an Expo module (cross-platform JS/TS API with full iOS implementation and background playback).

Android package summary:
- Multi-track playback with sample-accurate synchronization
- Real-time pitch shifting and time-stretch
- Per-track controls (volume, pan, mute, solo)
- Microphone recording (AAC/MP3/WAV)
- Offline extraction (track or mixdown)
- Low-latency I/O via Oboe

Android package install (JitPack):
- Repo: https://jitpack.io/#Sepzie/SezoAudioEngine
- Gradle dependency: com.github.Sepzie:SezoAudioEngine:VERSION
- Docs: https://sepzie.github.io/SezoAudioEngine/android/install/

Expo module summary:
- JS/TS API for Expo/React Native
- Android and iOS implementations
- Background playback support

Important notes:
- The engine expects absolute file paths, not content:// URIs
- Background playback requires platform configuration (permissions, Info.plist, and services)
- Recording requires RECORD_AUDIO permission on Android

Primary docs entry points:
- https://sepzie.github.io/SezoAudioEngine/
- https://sepzie.github.io/SezoAudioEngine/features/
- https://sepzie.github.io/SezoAudioEngine/android/overview/
- https://sepzie.github.io/SezoAudioEngine/android/api/
- https://sepzie.github.io/SezoAudioEngine/expo/overview/
- https://sepzie.github.io/SezoAudioEngine/expo/api/
